text: Google chrome needs a way to simulate a user preferring dark theme or preferring light theme
i'll talk with my people
slick site man
You can do that on a mac no?
or device?
<https://www.howtogeek.com/360650/how-to-enable-dark-mode-for-google-chrome/>
<https://medium.com/@jonas_duri/enable-dark-mode-with-css-variables-and-javascript-today-66cedd3d7845>
yes, you can do it. and I’m doing it for a project, it’s just the testing part I wish i didn’t have to change it on the system level for testing
ah.. gotcha. Nothing is Dev Tools is what your saying?
correct. <https://spin.d.pr/z4g3PH+>
i assume everyone is enroute to google I/O  which is why it is so quiet today
one day, I’m gonna go there

lol maybe I’ll try to use my Project ARA phone as my ticket in. (I have the project ARA modular cellphone Google tried to create but cancelled. It’s pretty cool, hopefully they revive it’s concept someday )
i doubt that is getting stood back up, sadly
I could see it happening, it’s all just a matter of the hardware side advancing and continuing to get smaller. The phone functioned fine. and you can detach all the little modules and move em around.
a modular phone? Sounds like a developers dream
i get it, i just dont see it happening.
do you get a case for the pieces?
carry a suitcase around with you with your parts
suitcase made of legos
was it motorola that still has a modular thing going on?
lol, no it didn’t come with anything, atleast how I got it. It was actually the first USB C phone I ever got
with that hasselblad lens that isnt very good in reality
yea Motorolla has the moto z, they’ve gone through multiple generations, people who have the phone love it
it is pretty cool

my wife has the first gen of it and got the projector mod free, it’s pretty cool. Not the sort of thing we use all the time, but we’ve used it to watch movies on our ceiling from bed. which is kinda neat
ha
that is great
should come with a fanny pack

but yea if you wanna see what my project ara phone looks like - this is litterally it <https://phandroid.com/2016/11/10/project-ara-specifications-photos/>
Let my buddy Nick borrow it for a week.
i remember drooling over it when it came out

I met one of the guys who worked on ARA he told me Google partnered with a ton of third party companies to produce modules for it. One of which was a Tardigrade mod. Basic jist of it was like taking tamagotchi to the next level, and actually having living creatures in your phone.
by far the weirdest thing he told me about but awesome at the same time
oh wow

other mods he talked about were what you expected - laser pointer, high end camera, extremely bright flash light, extended batteries, extra storage, projector, Infrared transmitter/receiver(tv remote), addon CPU/GPU.

He didn’t say all of those were actually being produced some were concepts that Google was trying to find a partner to produce. The tardigrade one was actually being produced.
can imagine more industry specific mods
it sounded like - let’s take an android phone, and make it an arduino, and let people come up with every crazy thing under the sun and see what happens
amen
the big con to the phone though was because of the extra hardware needed to handle all of the mods, it was blocky and kinda heavy(for a phone at the time).
cant please everyone
oh, the code highlighting slides is nice
i expect some spiffy presentations at inbound.  :wink:
what’s this?
oo, nice
<https://slides.com/news/code-line-numbers#/>
huh never heard of <http://slides.com|slides.com> till now
<https://slides.com/features>
:slightly_smiling_face:
yea looking through the site. I dig it
we can do our presentation with this, jon.  it will be a hoot
looks honestly perfect.
i think i found it from a chris coyier pesentation
I’ve heard of the library behind it - reveal.js. just never heard of this service on top of it. It was an obvious thing to create but really freaking awesome
